publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-588 Mr Brian Monteith: Openess Over Section 2A Consultation—That the Parliament notes that the consultation period over the repeal of section 2A of the Local Government Act 1986 has ended and calls upon the Scottish Executive to immediately publish the responses which have consented to the publication in the spirit of open government upon which the Scottish Parliament was founded.
S1M-588 Openness Over Section 2A Consultation (lodged on 22 February 2000) Alex Johnstone*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*

S1M-588 Mr Brian Monteith: Openness Over Section 2A Consultation—That the Parliament notes that the consultation period over the repeal of section 2A of the Local Government Act 1986 has ended and calls upon the Scottish Executive to immediately publish the responses which have consented to the publication in the spirit of open government upon which the Scottish Parliament was founded. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Nick Johnston*
S1M-588 Openness Over Section 2A Consultation (lodged on 22 February 2000) Mr Keith Harding*, Fergus Ewing*, Mary Scanlon*
S1M-588 Openness Over Section 2A Consultation (lodged on 22 February 2000) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*

S1M-588 Mr Brian Monteith: Openness Over Section 2A Consultation—That the Parliament notes that the consultation period over the repeal of section 2A of the Local Government Act 1986 has ended and calls upon the Scottish Executive to immediately publish the responses which have consented to the publication in the spirit of open government upon which the Scottish Parliament was founded. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Nick Johnston, Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing, Mary Scanlon, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh
S1M-588 Openness Over Section 2A Consultation (lodged on 22 February 2000) Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-588 Mr Brian Monteith: Openness Over Section 2A Consultation—That the Parliament notes that the consultation period over the repeal of section 2A of the Local Government Act 1986 has ended and calls upon the Scottish Executive to immediately publish the responses which have consented to the publication in the spirit of open government upon which the Scottish Parliament was founded. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Nick Johnston, Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing, Mary Scanlon, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor
S1M-588 Openness Over Section 2A Consultation (lodged on 22 February 2000) Mr David Davidson*

S1M-588 Mr Brian Monteith: Openness Over Section 2A Consultation—That the Parliament notes that the consultation period over the repeal of section 2A of the Local Government Act 1986 has ended and calls upon the Scottish Executive to immediately publish the responses which have consented to the publication in the spirit of open government upon which the Scottish Parliament was founded. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Nick Johnston, Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing, Mary Scanlon, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson

S1M-588 Mr Brian Monteith: Openness Over Section 2A Consultation—That the Parliament notes that the consultation period over the repeal of section 2A of the Local Government Act 1986 has ended and calls upon the Scottish Executive to immediately publish the responses which have consented to the publication in the spirit of open government upon which the Scottish Parliament was founded. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Nick Johnston, Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing, Mary Scanlon, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson

S1M-588 Mr Brian Monteith: Openness Over Section 2A Consultation—That the Parliament notes that the consultation period over the repeal of section 2A of the Local Government Act 1986 has ended and calls upon the Scottish Executive to immediately publish the responses which have consented to the publication in the spirit of open government upon which the Scottish Parliament was founded. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Nick Johnston, Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing, Mary Scanlon, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson
